modules.title: Introduction to SQL
modules.description: An introduction to SQL, its purpose, and its role in relational database management.

modules.title: Basic SQL Queries
modules.description: Learn the basics of querying data using SELECT statements and filtering with WHERE.

modules.title: Inserting and Updating Data
modules.description: Covers how to insert new records and update existing data in a SQL database.

modules.title: Deleting Data and Dropping Tables
modules.description: Explains how to delete records and drop tables from a SQL database.

modules.title: Joins in SQL
modules.description: Introduces SQL joins to combine data from multiple tables.

modules.title: Aggregating Data
modules.description: Learn how to use aggregate functions and group data in SQL queries.
points: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX functions

modules.title: Subqueries and Nested Queries
modules.description: Covers how to use subqueries to write more complex SQL queries.
points: Writing subqueries in SELECT and WHERE

modules.title: Database Design and Normalization
modules.description: Explains the principles of database design and normalization to optimize data storage.

modules.title: Indexes and Performance
modules.description: Learn how to use indexes to improve query performance in SQL databases.

modules.title: SQL Best Practices
modules.description: Covers best practices for writing efficient, secure, and maintainable SQL queries.

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to retrieve data from a database?
What clause is used to filter rows in a SQL query?
Which type of JOIN returns all rows from both tables, even if there is no match?
Which function counts the number of rows in a SQL query result?
What is the purpose of database normalization?
options: To reduce data redundancy and improve integrity
questions.answer: To reduce data redundancy and improve integrity
